claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

combined_evidence.quote: RIV4 (recombinant HA vaccine) Flublok Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5-mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote shows that Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen per 0.5 mL dose, which is three times the 15 µg/0.5 mL dose found in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the first part of the claim.

combined_evidence.quote: Fluzone Quadrivalent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5-mL PFS ≥6 mos 15 µg/0.5 mL IM
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides the HA antigen content for a standard-dose flu vaccine (15 µg/0.5 mL), which can be directly compared to Flublok's 45 µg/0.5 mL, supporting the claim that Flublok contains 3x the HA antigen content.

combined_evidence.quote: RIV4 (recombinant HA vaccine) ... has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This statement directly links the recombinant HA vaccine (RIV4, which is Flublok) to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines, supporting the second part of the claim.
